meanings.sent1: The movie was shticky with its overused jokes and predictable plot twists.
meanings.sent2: Her shticky writing style relied heavily on tired old tropes.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's shticky performance had the audience rolling with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The marketing campaign was shticky, trying too hard to grab attention.
meanings.sent5: The magician's shticky tricks amazed the crowd with their cleverness.

meanings.definition: A comedic routine or performance characterized by exaggerated or predictable humor
meanings.sent1: The clown's shticky involved lots of silly props and slapstick humor.
meanings.sent2: The sitcom's shticky never failed to make the audience laugh.
meanings.sent3: The shticky skit had everyone in stitches with its hilarious antics.
meanings.sent4: His shticky stand-up routine was a hit at the comedy club.
meanings.sent5: The play's shticky was so funny that people came back to see it again and again.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a showy or attention-seeking manner
meanings.sent1: She always wore shticky outfits to stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The actor's shticky behavior drew all eyes to him on stage.
meanings.sent3: His shticky gestures made everyone chuckle during the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The singer's shticky performance was the highlight of the show.
meanings.sent5: The politician's shticky speeches captivated the audience with their dramatic flair.
